div.p: This plugin allows users to interact with the Oracle WebLogic server and accomplish tasks such as starting and deploying applications, starting managed servers, and running Jython scripts.

Supported WebLogic version
This plugin was developed and tested with WebLogic version 11g (10.3.4).
To enable Commander to communicate with your WebLogic server, create a WebLogic configuration, supplying the following information:

ul.li: Configuration Name - Provide a unique name for the configuration, keeping in mind that you may need to create additional configurations over time.
URL - Provide the URL for the WebLogic server, it must include the protocol and port (example: t3://localhost:7001).
Credential - Provide the username and password for the WebLogic Admin Server.

div.p: See the Commander online help system for details about how to use this plugin within a procedure.
When you provide information for this plugin, fill-in the fields as follows:

The StartManagedServer subprocedure starts a specified managed server instance on the selected resource machine. Required credentials must be stored securely in a boot.properties file. StartManagedServer has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
instancename - Provide the name of the instance to start.
scriptlocation - Provide the absolute path to the start server script. It must include the filename and extension.
wlstabspath - Provide the absolute path to the wlst executable. It must include the filename and extension.

div.p: The StartAdminServer subprocedure starts a specified admin server instance on the selected resource machine. StartAdminServer has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
admininstancename - Provide the Admin Server instance name to start.
wlstabspath - Provide the absolute path to the wlst executable. It must include the filename and extension.
scriptlocation - Provide the absolute path to the start server script. It must include the filename and extension.

div.p:
The StopManagedServer subprocedure stops a specified managed server on the selected resource. StopManagedServer has the following fields:
instancename - Provide the name of the instance to stop.
scriptlocation - Provide the absolute path to the stop server script. It must include the filename and extension.

The StopAdminServer subprocedure stops a specified Admin Server instance on the selected resource. StopAdminServer has the following fields:
scriptlocation - Provide the absolute path to the stop server script. It must include the filename and extension.

The CheckServerStatus subprocedure checks the status of the specified server.
CheckServerStatus has the following fields:

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server. In this case, only credentials are taken from the configuration.
instancename - Indicate the name of the server instance to check.
maxelapsedtime - Define the maximum time in seconds that the job will try to check into the server. Blank implies no wait time (server only checked once).

successcriteria - Indicate the expected correct result to be obtained, either Server running or Server not running. If the indicated success criteria matches the returned result, it is considered successful, otherwise the step fails.
wlstabspath - Provide the absolute path to the wlst executable. It must include the filename and extension.

div.p: The CheckPageStatus subprocedure checks the status of the specified page, by getting the returned HTTP code from the URL.

ul.li: configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
maxelapsedtime - Indicate the maximum allowed time to check the status of a page.

successcriteria - Indicate the status of the page that must be matched, either a Page found or a Page not found status. If the indicated success criteria matches the returned status at the end of the analysis, it is considered successful. Otherwise, it is an error in the job.
targeturl - Provide the URL of the page to check.

div.p: The RunWLST subprocedure runs Jython scripts on the server. RunWLST has the following fields:

ul.li: wlstpath - Provide the absolute path to the wlst executable. It must include the filename and extension.
scriptfilepath - Provide the absolute path to the Jython script to execute with WLST.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for WLST.

scriptfilesource - Indicate the source of the script file. Supplied file uses the file whose path is indicated in the scriptfilepath parameter and executes it. New Script File indicates that a script file with the content of the scriptfile parameter will be executed.
scriptfile - Provide the content of the script file to execute if New Script File is selected in the scriptfilesource parameter.

div.p: The StartApp subprocedure is starts an application on the server. StartApp has the following fields:

ul.li: javaparams - Provide any Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Provide the absolute Java location to use. The filename is required. The default is java.
appname - Provide the name of the application to start.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Provide the absolute path to the setDomainEnv script, including the filename and extension.

div.p: The StopApp subprocedure is stops an application on the server. StopApp has the following fields:

ul.li: javaparams - Provide any Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Provide the absolute Java location to use. The filename is required. The default is java.
appname - Provide the name of the application to stop.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Provide the absolute path to the setDomainEnv script, including the filename and extension.
gracefulmode - If checked, this enables stopping the application in graceful mode.

div.p: The DeployApp subprocedure deploys an application on the server. The following fields are available for DeployApp:

ul.li: javaparams - Provide any Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Provide the absolute Java location to use. The filename is required. The default is java.
appname - Provide the name of the application to deploy.
apppath - Provide the absolute path to the archive to deploy, including the filename and extension.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for weblogic.Deployer.
targets - Provide the targets on which to deploy the application or module.
envscriptpath - Provide the absolute path to the setDomainEnv script, including the filename and extension.

div.p: The UndeployApp subprocedure undeploys an application on the server. UndeployApp has the following fields:

ul.li: javaparams - Provide any Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Provide the absolute Java location to use. The filename is required. The default is java.
appname - Provide the name of the application to undeploy.
apppath - Provide the absolute path to the archive to undeploy, including the filename and extension.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Provide the absolute path to the setDomainEnv script, including the filename and extension.
gracefulmode - If checked, this enables undeploying the application in graceful mode.

div.p: The RunDeployer subprocedure runs weblogic.Deployer in a free-mode, specifying the command and parameters. RunDeployer has the following fields:

ul.li: commandtouse - Indicate the command to pass to weblogic.Deployer (Cancel, Deploy, Distribute, Listapps, List, Listtask, Redeploy, Start, Stop, Undeploy, Update).
javaparams - Provide any Java options to add to the process.
javapath - Provide the absolute Java location to use. The filename is required. The default is java.
appname - Provide the name of the application to manage.
configname - Provide the name of the configuration that holds connection information for the WebLogic server.
additionalcommands - Provide any additional parameters for weblogic.Deployer.
envscriptpath - Provide the absolute path to the setDomainEnv script, including the filename and extension.
